intro: Scabiosa lutescens, commonly known as the yellow scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and grasslands. Scabiosa lutescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
